baseline_groups.claim_summary: Gender (female) has essentially zero effect on divorce probability among married couples, controlling for age group, children, and dependents.
baseline_groups.notes: Spec 1 (divorce) and spec 5 (stay_married) are algebraic complements: stay_married = 1 - divorce, so their coefficients are equal in magnitude but opposite in sign (-0.000274 vs +0.000274, p=0.971). Both are included as baselines in this group. Sample restricted to married in 1994 (N=5994). Controls: female + age dummies + child94 + dep94.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Females are marginally less likely to transition from single to married, controlling for age group, children, and dependents.
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient -0.0266, p=0.059. Sample restricted to single in 1994 (N=4080). Controls: female + age dummies + child94 + dep94.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Females are significantly more likely to become widowed, controlling for age group, children, dependents, and marital status.
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient +0.0237, p<0.001. Full sample (N=10074). Controls: female + age dummies + child94 + dep94 + married94. Strongest and most robust result.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Females are significantly less likely to be married in 1999, controlling for age group, children, dependents, and marital status.
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient -0.0203, p=0.003. Full sample (N=10074). Controls: female + age dummies + child94 + dep94 + married94.

global_notes: This is a structural calibration paper (Hong and Rios-Rull, AER 2012). The specification search constructs reduced-form regressions of PSID microdata examining gender-specific marital transition probabilities. The paper's primary contribution is a life-cycle model, not reduced-form estimation. The 'treatment' variable (female) is demographic rather than a policy intervention. Specs 1 and 5 are algebraic complements (divorce = 1 - stay_married), so they are grouped together in G1. Many specifications change the treatment variable (e.g., child94, dep94, age_94, q) or the outcome variable (delta_dep, delta_child, etc.), which fundamentally change the estimand. The divorce result (G1) is extremely robust but near-zero; the widowhood result (G3) is strongly significant across all specifications.
